column4: Need help mounting external drive.  No /media/external mount point.  fdisk -l  not showing device
what sort of device is it?
then you plug it in, check dmesg output.
what is check dmesg command?
run 'dmesg' look for errors a few moments after plugging in the drive
you waited a few moments? then ran it? try again a few secconds later
if dmesg is showing NOTHING about that device.. then you got somthng very weird going on.
at the end, it should mention some* devices
similer to -->  [45781.487869] usb 2-1.1: new high-speed USB device number 11 using ehci_hcd
notice the 'sdg' - thats the device in my case.
whens the last time you ever used that external hard drive? in any OS.
if its disconnecting automatically. that points to some issue - perhaps in the hardware/cable/power/ports
fist used a year ago, haven't been able to connect since.
untill the os gives the hd a proper /dev/sdXX  you are not going to be doing much of anything with it.
that ##### is a timestamp of the kernel logging  i belive
if the os is not giveing it a  /dev/sdXX name.you cant do much of anything with it...
id check the cables and listen to the hd and be sure its even spinning up
HD recognized on mac.... ?
you are asking a question?
what filesystem is on that hard drive?
Why do you need it to be fat?
you could just delete the paritons. and then plug it back in and see if linux sees it.
opened external in disk utility (Mac OSX).  ran test, then repair.  auto mounted in /media when i plugged it back into ubuntu.  ~Thank you for your patience and helping me out
